results.title: Ikebana: Japanese art of flower arrangement
results.brief_description: Ikebana is the Japanese art of flower arrangement which is now known throughout the Western world. The history, principles and theory of this type of flower arrangement are told.

results.creator_credit: Robert Graff, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company

results.title: If these were your children. Part 1
results.brief_description: Focuses on the behaviour of young children to help interpret early clues to possible emotional problems. Depicts the activities and behaviour of a group of second-grade children with their teacher during an ordinary school day. Includes conversations between the teacher and parents which illustrate the influence of the home.

results.title: If only we'd known
results.brief_description: A series of 3 “trigger” films designed to stimulate discussion, led by a discussion leader. Part 1 - “Debbie and Linda”, concerns a 16 year old schoolgirl who thinks she is pregnant, and turns to her friend Linda, who is expecting a baby. Following this, a doctor is seen interviewing another pregnant teenage girl. Part 2 - “Clinic Talk” - Deborah has just had her pregnancy confirmed - is paying her first visit to the ante-natal clinic. Now, as she waits for her boyfriend she meets Sarah, who is expecting her second child. Part 3 - “Sarah and Eric”. Sarah arrives home from the ante-natal clinic and tells her husband Eric that she has been told to take it easy. Eric persuades her to keep working, as they need the money, and adds that everything was all right when they had their first child.

results.title: If at first you don't succeed: you don't succeed [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodchild, Edward Goldwyn and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. Child psychologists can now measure a new-born baby’s capacity for solving complex problems and they have found that the infant’s motivation is the sheer joy of solving the problems, but if the potential is not developed the damage is irreversible. The results of this research are having major implications for education.

results.title: If a boy can't learn
results.creator_credit: Lawrence A Williams, Susan S Trout and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of a boy with learning disabilities, who is sent to a Learning Disabilities Center for diagnostic workup and testing. A specialist confers with the boy’s teachers and together they improvise ways of teaching to his strengths in order to compensate for his disabilities and help him learn. Excellent for teacher training and can be valuable to parents.
